description.p: A web controller servlet represents a HTTP endpoint in a Java web application, which responds to a request by forwarding the response to a new URL.
description.div:
The full flow of what the web controller servlet can do is:
Accept a request at a URL
Be configured to use one or more Servlet HTTP Filters.
Read HTTP parameters from the request (optional)
Look for a user session data object in the session (optional)
Invoke a business rule, using HTTP parameters and attributes of the user session data object as parameters (optional)
Conditionally forward the response to a URL

description.p: The name of the web servlet. This will be used to create the URL for the servlet. The servlet will be available from in web application's root URI path.
